content: hacky sack materials ★ fingering weight yarn ⭑i used madeline tosh merino light https //madelinetosh com/collections/top-40 ★ size b/ 1-2 225 mm crochet hook gauge 4 x 1 = 32 stitches x 8 row in single_crochet crochet this quite tight to keep the filling inside and help prevent the hacky sack from stretching out method entire pattern is worked in single_crochet ★ single_crochet 4 in a magic_ring join with a slip_stitch keep your yarn tail at the front of your work to save you from having to tuck it into the sack later ★ increase every stitch repeat 16 stitches ★ work even ★ increase every other stitch ★ work even ★ increase every 3rd stitch ★ work even ★ increase every 4th stitch ★ work even for 5 row ★ decrease every 4th stitch ★ work even ★ decrease every 3rd stitch ★ work even ★ decrease every other stitch ★ work even ★ fill your sack with desired eco-friendly filling i find that lentils work well as they are a bit heavier and sturdier than rice or other legumes ★ decrease every stitch until you can t anymore slip_stitch if necessary to close the hole bobble and nudge the yarn tail inside with the end of your crochet hook ★ have fun
